DOC.brief_summary: This study involve 25 current young adult combustible tobacco cigarette ( CTC ) smokers complete 5 Latin square order , within-subject , laboratory condition differ tobacco product smoke : 1. own-brand CTC ( positive control ) , 2. original-flavored Black & Mild ( B & M ) cigar , 3. apple-flavored B & M cigar , 4. cream-flavored B & M cigar , 5. wine-flavored B & M cigar .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Cigar Flavors Measures Abuse Liability Among Young Adults
DOC.criteria: To include , participant must healthy , determined selfreport heart rate/blood pressure ( HR/BP ) check , age 1821 , willing provide inform consent . They must agree attend lab abstain tobacco/nicotine require , use designate product , follow study protocol . Participants must also regular CTC smoker ( ≥5 cigarettes/day past 3 month ) naïve cigar product ( smoke 5 cigar product type lifetime ) provide semiquantitative urine cotinine result ≥3 screening ( NicAlert test ) . Individuals selfreported history chronic diseases psychiatric condition exclude . Other exclusion criterion : history active cardiovascular disease , current oral health problem injury , low/high BP , seizures , regular prescription medication use ( vitamin birth control ) , past month use cocaine , opioids , benzodiazepine , methamphetamine ( selfreport ) . Individuals report use marijuana alcohol > 20 day past 30 also exclude . Women exclude breastfeed test positive pregnancy ( urinalysis ) screening .
